movies.title: The Man with the Twisted Lip
movies.plot: Nellie St. Clair becomes distraught over the disappearance of Neville, her respectable, middle-class husband last seen in the second story window of a seedy waterfront dive and seeks out Holmes and Watson for help. When Holmes and the police arrive, they find a filthy beggar, not St. Clair, in the building which also serves as an opium den. The missing man's clothes are found in the room along with his son's broken toy and a bloody fingerprint on the window sill. Holmes initially suspects foul play especially after St. Clair's coat, weighted down with with copper coins, is found on a nearby riverbank. However, after the Great Detective interviews the beggar in his cell, he is able to solve the case and reunite Mrs. St. Clair with her husband.
movies.simplePlot: Holnmes finds that the disappearance of respectable middle class Neville St. Clair may be linked to a filthy beggar living above an opium den.

biography.bio: Eille Norwood was born on October 11, 1861 in York, England as Anthony Edward Brett. He was an actor, known for The Boscombe Valley Mystery (1922), The Dying Detective (1921) and The Man with the Twisted Lip (1921). He was married to Ruth Mackay. He died on December 24, 1948 in London, England.
biography.name: Eille Norwood

biography.bio: Hubert Willis was born in 1862 in Reading, Berkshire, England. He was an actor, known for The Lion's Cubs (1915), The Boscombe Valley Mystery (1922) and The Dying Detective (1921). He was married to Mrs. Hubert Willis. He died on December 13, 1933 in Bedford Park, London, England.
biography.name: Hubert Willis

biography.bio: Robert Vallis was born on March 2, 1875 in Pimlico, London, England as Robert Hardy Vallis. He was an actor, known for The Man with the Twisted Lip (1921), The Tragedy of a Comic Song (1921) and Beautiful Kitty (1923). He died on December 19, 1932 in Brighton, East Sussex, England.
biography.name: Robert Vallis

biography.bio: Paulette del Baze is an actress, known for The Man with the Twisted Lip (1921).
biography.name: Paulette del Baze
